thread.title: Trump says still looking at June 12 summit with Kim

title: Trump says still looking at June 12 summit with Kim

locations.name: oval office of the white house

text:
May 27, 2018 / 1:17 AM / Updated 18 minutes ago Trump says still looking at June 12 summit with Kim Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he was still looking at a June 12 summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un in Singapore, adding that talks were progressing very well. FILE PHOTO: U.S. President Donald Trump look on as he welcomes South Korea's President Moon Jae-In in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, U.S., May 22, 2018. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque /File Photo
“We’re doing very well in terms of the summit with North Korea,” Trump said at the White House. “It’s moving along very nicely. So we’re looking at June 12th in Singapore. That hasn’t changed. So, we’ll see what happens.” Reporting By Lucia Mutikani and Tim Ahmann; Editing by Susan Thomas
